sentences.sContent: A micrometer is one thousandth of one millimeter.
sentences.sContent_eng: A micrometer is one thousandth of one millimeter.
sentences.sCn: 一微米是一毫米的千分之一。

sentences.sContent: We're also good at seeing big clouds of small particles of dust. ... But in between dust grains up to a millimeter in size and the smallest planets we can see, we're blind.
sentences.sContent_eng: We're also good at seeing big clouds of small particles of dust. ... But in between dust grains up to a millimeter in size and the smallest planets we can see, we're blind.
sentences.sCn: 我们也同样擅长于发现那些一大堆的尘埃...但是如果要去发现那些毫米级的尘埃，和那些我们能看到的最小的行星，我们几乎就成了盲人。

sentences.sContent: On average these mosses grow at the glacial speed of 1 millimeter per year—and some of the turfs are meters thick.
sentences.sContent_eng: On average these mosses grow at the glacial speed of 1 millimeter per year—and some of the turfs are meters thick.
sentences.sCn: 平均来说，这些苔藓以每年大约1毫米的极慢速度生长，而某些草皮有数米厚。

remMethod.val: milli(毫， 千分之一)+metre(米)→毫米
